website_summaries.verdict: An advanced digital steam iron that gives you precise controls over the temperature and the amount of steam.
pros: Customizable settings adjust the amount of steam to suit the type of fabric
Use vertically to steam clothes on the hanger
cons: There have been some complaints about this iron leaking

customer_reviews.title: Defective iron - both times
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this iron. Shortly after our initial purchase the iron simply died. In order to get a full exchange from the company, we had to send it back, wait for it to be processed and then were sent a re-furbished replacement - two weeks later. On our second replacement, the auto-off never worked and after several months, it too completely stopped working. Call me old fashioned, but I have an expectation that if I am going spend a reasonable amount of money on a product I expect it to work longer than 8 months. Sadly, this was not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Fisher

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST fun to iron!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect weight - not too heavy yet heavy enough to iron out wrinkles without bearing down on it. Glides smoothly. I got some gunk on it from spray starch and it cleaned right up, using a sponge dipped in warm water with dishwashing liquid. Easy to fill and easy to check how much water is in the iron for steam/spray, too. Several settings. I use the highest - Linen - on my 100% cotton sheets. It's almost fun to iron with this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Joie

customer_reviews.title: but I purchased the same iron again since it had worked great previously and it has such high Amazon reviews
customer_reviews.text: A couple of months after I purchased this iron, it stopped working properly, spewing water everywhere. Silly me, but I purchased the same iron again since it had worked great previously and it has such high Amazon reviews. Within two days, it became inoperable. I can't even power it on. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE REVIEWS!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Benner

customer_reviews.title: Auto Steam
customer_reviews.text: Im a little OCD when it comes to irons so when I say this iron is worth every penny of the $ 50 bucks --trust me it is. What a concept --there is a setting that keeps the steam coming without pushing a button !
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it .. if you want this to last smh
customer_reviews.text: Well it lasted a year and now it’s leaking water by the cord ... my shirt is wet ... just marvelous
customer_reviews.author: Jassy

customer_reviews.title: An Iron Is Suppose To Be Forever Not 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: Black & Decker where is your quality assurance? After reading the great reviews and seeing it being the #1 Best Garment Seller, I went ahead and ordered the iron. I purchased the iron on 8/1/14 and everything was fine, it worked great. Well today 1/9/15 while ironing it just died, 4 months later. The iron was never damaged, mishandled or dropped. The iron completely shut off, then water started streaming out of the bottom of the sole plate and the electronic temperature gauge was acting as if it was on the fritz Definitely would not recommend this iron. Save your money and put it towards a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce D.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST iron I have ever had! DO NOT BUY!!!! It had ruined several of my shirts because it spits up this brown liquid when I use it (reference image of the device with brown burnt type marks and the liquid stains on my ironing board)! I will never buy Black and Decker again
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Good iron so far
customer_reviews.text: Good iron so far. Purchased a different Black and Decker iron that only lasted me 6 months, so Im hoping this one lasts longer. Product true to description. Easy to use. Not heavy. Easy read digital display. Heats up quickly. I wish that the dark grey area was a tad lighter because that is where the water fill tank is at, and when I fill it up, I have to hold it up to the light more to be able to see where the water level is.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: One small problem
customer_reviews.text: This iron works well. The only problem that I have had is that the steam selection switch seems to always work it’s way back to the lowest setting. I never notice this until the ironing starts to get difficult becasue the steam has stopped flowing. Once I turn it back up ironing is great again. Other than that the iron works great. I really like the digital setting for the temperature/material control and the ability to quickly turn off the iron prior to unplugging.
customer_reviews.author: tlhpkh

customer_reviews.title: No Heat Makes a Useless Iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron worked fine the first several times I used it. Now I can't get it to heat. It turns on and does not heat. It did it once and then I turned it off and back on again and it heated fine. However, today I tried several times to get it to heat and it wouldn't heat. Unfortunately I am past my Amazon return date so I have to contact Black and Decker. I would not waste my money on this product. An iron is not something you use everyday and when you do need it then it should work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brucker

customer_reviews.title: Great for clothes, bad for grilled cheese
customer_reviews.text: The time came to buy an iron that didn't just show up at some point during college and didn't have anything weird adhered to the metal plate. As any busy normal human would, I researched for 3+ hours to find an iron that checked all the boxes: functional, had an easy-pour steam area, and easy-to-understand settings. Not only did this one go beyond that (digital number settings that beep when the temperature is right!), but it also turns off if it is facedown and not moving for more than 30 seconds. Nice. I highly recommend this as long as you have an alternate way to make grilled cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Park

customer_reviews.title: Not a good iron model
customer_reviews.text: PLease note this is a late review. I purchased this items several years ago, 2009, so in all fairness the manufacturer may have upgraded this model Review based on model purchased in 2009 I am sorry to say that i had to get rid of this iron and switch to a Rowenta.From the moment I purchased it there were problems. I will outline them in the cons section Pros sturdy clear water level glass digital display Cons poor steam stream, too few steam holes does not iron out wrinkles well LEAKS, LEAKS, LEAKS water constantly wish it had improved lightening sensor for darker rooms Summary: overall this was a bad iron. I do hope the manufacturer did upgrade the product
customer_reviews.author: xavg

customer_reviews.title: Need pressed creases? This is it.
customer_reviews.text: I had this iron for a long time then it died. I am probably considered a heavy iron user. Tried many others. None compare. If you need steam and want parade dress quality creases.....this iron is it. Heats fast and the push button steam shot is outstanding. I’ve had the big money irons too. I love this thing so much I almost always travel with it. I get asked who/where presses my shirts.....I do!
customer_reviews.author: AA-Ron

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly balanced, low drag, minimal torque
customer_reviews.text: They carve it out of illegal whalebone. Just kidding. This is a iron, for like shirts and pants, and in emergency situations grilled cheese sandwiches. Has a digital display, which is really the only reason I purchased it. Works extremely well. I have never had a more wrinkle free grilled cheese, or a more cheesy shirt for work.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Awful user interface.
customer_reviews.text: While the iron is fine and fulfills its intended purpose, the one button digital interface is poorly designed and frankly, obnoxious. It's a nuisance to have to click the button six times every time I want to turn it on and iron a cotton shirt. This is the result of clueless design. This ridiculous thing is going right back.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: You had just one job to do .....
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a year. No leaking problems as many others have stated, but it is very lackluster when it comes to getting wrinkles out. Isn't an iron supposed to be hot enough to get the doggone wrinkles out? I have to use it constantly on the highest setting - linen. It does not get even a cotton tee shirt smooth. I'm done messing around with it and am on Amazon to buy yet another iron. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Lalo

customer_reviews.title: This iron does not get hot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to replace an old black and silver Black & Decker iron that decided to start leaking water all the time. This iron has mostly good reviews, but despite higher wattage than my old iron, it does not get hot. I expect the cotton im ironing to be so hot after pressing, that it is too hot to immediately handle. This iron comes nowhere close, and leaves my clothes wrinkled. The spray pattern is poor and the baseplate does not glide easily. The cord also seems to always get in the way. The only good thing I can say is that it does have a large water reservoir. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non-existent warranty
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, if you are interested in a warranty. It lasted two months and would not heat or display. I've filled out the online form twice in the past two months. It gives a reference number and says you will be contacted in 24 hrs, but nothing else. Doesn't even copy you with a confirmation email. I have tried to call a couple of times, but at around 7:00 eastern time the recording states to call back during their business hours. Remembering to do this during the day when at work is not high on my list of priorities for a 40.00 iron.
customer_reviews.author: Barry White

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY HEAVY 😦 I CAN'T IMAGINE ANYBODY WANTING TO USE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: It showed up as a used iron, the packing was missing, there was water in it, BUT I figured since it's here I might as well try it? FIRST thing I noticed is it's about 4 times the weight of my old iron, I didn't find the controls easy to use, the steam blaster button didn't work, I realize this is probably a return, but even if it wasn't, THE WEIGHT of it alone is A DEAL BREAKER, this is an EXTREMELY HEAVY IRON! :(
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel ❤️

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product that doesn't last a darn.
customer_reviews.text: Had this just a couple of months and it is broke and unusable already. I handled this very carefully without any abuse and the power unit, internal wiring or something already is broke. It just shut off on it's own. When you wiggle the cord it comes back on but shuts right back off whenever you touch it. Plus, the darn thing weighs a ton and it very bad for someone who has arthritis to iron with; hard to maintain holding it for doing more than one set of tops and bottoms.. Very displeased and wasted $40 for nothing. Wish it would have done it within return time because I definitely would've returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schuetz

customer_reviews.title: I don't want to have to adjust the temperature control every time
customer_reviews.text: Irons pretty well. Steam button works well, but it doesn't steam much without pushing the steam button. Biggest issue I don't like is that every time you plug in the iron, you have to push the button to set your temperature control. To get to "cotton" you have to push the button 5 times - every time you plug it in. Not a huge deal, but annoying and a poor engineering choice.
customer_reviews.author: G. Winslow

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par
customer_reviews.text: I owned the same model i had bought in 2008, that one worked great until its recent failure. I bought it again, and that one out of the box had problems in that when it was in the iron position (horizontal), no steam would come out until i would shake it hard. I returned to amazon, and replaced with another. Now, about a month into it, it also has the same problem. In my opinion, the model looks the same on the outside, but its internal parts are maybe not the same, as it don't work great like the original model i bought. Going to a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Larry a

customer_reviews.title: Nice features but got a faulty one
customer_reviews.text: Our old iron broke so we bought this one to replace. The iron has few nice feature like a wide range of temp controls along with a range of steam controls. It felt nice and had a good weight to it. After a week or so of using everyday, it started to turn on and off. I was thinking that it was our outlet that was broken because this iron was new. Turned out the iron was faulty. It also had a big burst of steam that blew out all this residue onto my clothes. Maybe I just got a defected one but either way, I was not happy so returned.
customer_reviews.author: VuuFam

customer_reviews.title: It Spits
customer_reviews.text: I need an iron that doesn't spit drops on the steam function. From the reviews, I thought this was it. It isn't. I collect antique linens. Over time, those drops turn into rust spots. Why can't someone make a decent iron that doesn't do this? ARGHHH! Other than that, I like the weight of the iron and the swiveling cord. Some irons advertise that they are "light weight." Heavier irons do a better job and this iron is heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old and very cheap iron that we had for years. Definitely an upgrade for us and no problems after a few months. Will update if we have any issues. I considered buying more expensive options, but this one seemed to have better reviews anyway so I went with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Choosy MooseTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This iron is a big upgrade from my old one. There is a precise digital fabric selector that works very nice. The build quality is very good and the included water reservoir filler is a nice touch because it allows for an easy refill of the tank. My only gripe is the steam selector is marked weird so it's hard to understand which way to turn for more or less steam.
customer_reviews.author: NomadCC

customer_reviews.title: Worked good at first...now leaks water everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this iron for just under a year now. The only negative (up to just recently) was that the steam was inconsistent. I learned that I had to cycle the dial to off, and then on, for it to work. Lately, the iron leaks LOTS of water from the bottom. I’ve tried everything, multiple times, and nothing has fixed this problem. So, it’s now unusable and worthless. NOT what I expected from Black+Decker!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS NICE BUT LACKING IN PERFORMANCE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron in September 2018 because of the rave reviews. Unfortunately, it began spitting/leaking water a year to date :(!!! Although the design is sleek and lightweight with a smooth steel plate, the overall performance of the iron is lacking terribly. It doesn't maintain heat and the water reservoir quickly depletes... has to be refilled at least three times before I can finish ironing a blouse! I've owned several Black and Decker classic irons which lasted at least 10 years before needing to be replaced. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!! Black and Decker dropped the ball on this one!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara V

customer_reviews.title: It's iron.
customer_reviews.text: The presence of LEDs do not really enhance the performance or operation of the iron. The title refers to the product being "professional", yet, the owner manual says this product is not meant to be used professionally. Because of the stainless bottom plate, the iron is noticeably heavier than the iron it is replacing, however, I do not really notice any improvement ironing ability. I may not iron enough to be tuned in to the nuances of different sole plates.
customer_reviews.author: RFKIII

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product quality and worse customer service
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this thing. Worked 5 times. Worked with B&D and they said they would warranty it, provided I sent them the cord (at my expense) and a check for $7.50. Bought a $15 one from Wal-Mart instead. Terrible product quality and worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: This iron is it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love to iron so to find an iron that works perfectly and does it’s job makes me love ironing even more! This iron is sturdy and heavy but not in a bad way. It is heavy in a way that you only need to go over the area once and the job is done! It seems to be well made and reminds me of old school engineering which is a great thing. One more thing. The way the cord is designed, it doesn’t get in the way or wrinkle what it touches if that was ever a problem you may have experienced. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mikala

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this iron. I iron about 20 shirts a month so my iron gets used a lot. The first one lasted me about 6 years which seems like a great lifetime for an iron. I liked it so much that I bought the same iron this time around. It is a great weight, not too heavy but heavy enough to do the job. It produces a great amount of steam or spray when needed. This really is a great iron for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill with water, improved over previous B&D irons - good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value and performance. This improved every shortcoming with our prior B&D iron, that just died. This one is much easier to fill with water (even comes with a small water dispenser to use). The plate is nice and smooth, and moves easily over fabrics. The temperature settings seem consistent, and correct for the different kinds of fabrics. It even offers vertical steam function, ideal for getting the wrinkles out of drapes or clothing on a hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago but just today used it for the second time. Easy to fill and use and very useful temperature gradations. This replaced a B&D iron that I bought 40 years ago which still works (I gave it to my son when he went off to college.) Like my previous iron, the cord wraps around the base and stays there. The cord is long enough to get around the ironing board without havinf a plug right there. Hopefully this one will hold up as well as my old one did..
customer_reviews.author: Crjsahm

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron, Even for Linen
customer_reviews.text: This is the second model of this iron that I've purchased, only because I dropped the first on a hard floor and paid the price. This iron is easy and effortless, and performs with great results. Steams perfectly, and irons like no ones business, and I particularly like the simple readout for specific fabrics. It has a linen setting and that makes this wrinkled guy happy, too.
customer_reviews.author: TomC SEA

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!  Best Iron Ever .....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron after reading all the positive reviews -- and every one was true. Fastest turnaround ever on husband's shirts! Heavy (weighted with water) but slick on the fabric and easy to handle with fabulous steam and a substantial water reservoir that I only had to fill once for 14+ shirts! What used to be a chore that I put off for weeks (while the to-be-ironed shirt pile grew) was a breeze tonight -- and I cannot wait until the next laundry day! Love love love it!
customer_reviews.author: Susi

customer_reviews.title: Good iron but.....
customer_reviews.text: This iron works very well but my biggest complaint is that the rounded spinner for temperature keep getting shuffled around because of its extremely poor placement. I’ve been happily ironing and then my stream stops and it’s because your hands run against the knob. Makes the whole process a pain otherwise it’s a great iron just maybe put tape on the knob so it’s doesn’t slide around
customer_reviews.author: D. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Good iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron works great. My only complaint is that it doesnt auto steam, you have to keep pushing the button down over and over. If you iron 3+ hours a week, that gets tough. Otherwise, it's a good weight and heats up quickly. Holds a lot of water too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible iron. I was replacing an earlier version of this iron that I had purchased about 10 years ago (which was much, much better than this). This is heavy, doesn’t heat up properly and is painful to use. I purchased a Rowenta & this iron. I just wish I had purchased two Rowentas. The price point reflects its quality. Pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Keep searching
customer_reviews.text: Great features, it looks cool but IT LEAKS! I bought this in July and haven't used it until today. I poured water in it and not even 2 minutes later all the water is dripping out on the floor from the cord and iron area. I was so excited to use a digital iron and I thought black and decker was a reliable brand. I am highly dissapointed and unfortunatly my children have a habit of throwing boxes away so I cant return it. This is a total waste of money BUY at YOUR OWN RISK.
customer_reviews.author: BUNNy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Steam irons very well when the distilled water stays in. My iron has been leaking water regardless of setting. The manual did state it will do it occasionally, I guess to clean it self. I will rest the iron down to get the next piece of garment, when I turn around the distilled water is flooding out. I will not buy again. I am searching for my replacement. Can't be bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Reliable company
customer_reviews.text: I have always been pleased with Black and Decker products and this iron is no exception. I had purchased a much more expensive dressmakers steam iron before this and although it handled quite nicely and fit my hand, it developed a leak in the face plate after just a few months. This time I chose to stick with a brand I know is reliably good, if not the slickest design. It does not fit my hand as well, but I don't believe it will spring any leaks. It is a heavy iron with wonderful steam features.
customer_reviews.author: Guintry

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice iron. It is heavy and feels like it is well made. It is much nicer than the more expensive Rowenta it is replacing. I like the digital because it is easy to see what setting it is on in the morning, and easy to see that I have turned it off. The best thing is that no water comes out when I'm ironing. It's the only iron I've ever owned where the water does not leak out and get all over whatever I'm ironing. I haven't had any issues with the buttons for the burst/spray that one reviewer had, my thumb reaches easy to both. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: Though this iron was heavier than expected, it looks nice. Strike one, this iron comes up with power on after plugging it in. You have to turn the power off, the auto power off did not appear to work. Strike two, after approximately 4 hours of use during a month and a half, the iron failed to show any signs of life at all. Apparently the only option we have now is to attempt to a return in exchange for a refurbished iron. I'm not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hanchett

customer_reviews.title: Must rock sideways
customer_reviews.text: As a quilter I iron yards of fabric and press 100s of seams and this iron does a great job except it shuts down while in use because I am a slow and steady ironer and presser. Simply setting the iron on its heel does not reactivate the heat. I have found I have to rock the iron right of left as I set it down to keep the heat timer activated. No biggie once you realize what is happening and it soon becomes a habit. It may be just my individual iron that has this quirk ,.
customer_reviews.author: Flo Jo

customer_reviews.title: Nice iron so far but I don't see the bragged about power to take the wrinkles out
customer_reviews.text: I like the irons functions, but so far it doesn't seem powerful enough to take the wringles out and it was delivered poorly. It was not left on my porch like all my other amazon packages, it was put on the ground on the side of the house by my garage and I didn't find it for (2) days, one of which it was pouring rain. So I ended up with a rain soaked wet box, I'm that's not the reason it doesn't get the wrinkles out.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Elliott

customer_reviews.title: This one performs just fine; however
customer_reviews.text: My first iron was a Rowenta from a clearance table. It lasted more than a decade. I decided to save a little money and buy this one to replace the Rowenta. This one performs just fine; however, it only lasted 4 years. Guessing I got unlucky with the first one, I purchased another one of these and it died in 13 months (1 month out of warranty). In short, I am pleased with the performance of the iron but not the lack of longevity. I am going back to Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: calcboy

customer_reviews.title: and am still looking for a GOOD one.
customer_reviews.text: leaks, have already ruined 3 pieces of fabric. It turns itself off while ironing and the sole plate needs continual cleaning. The container used to add water has to be filled at least twice if not 3 times to fill the iron. Would not purchase a Black & Decker iron ever again and I sew and quilt so I use my iron ALOT! Have owned many irons, expensive and cheap, and am still looking for a GOOD one.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Daigle

customer_reviews.title: Best One
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. I have used it for the last two years and I am still thrilled with it. Perfect weight (it is heavier so it doesn't need you to lean on it), incredibly intelligent and user friendly (with display and different temperature options). I truly feel like this is a little helpful loyal robot that every household needs. Would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Damiana Acuña

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water out of box
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews on many irons, I finally settled on this one for the price and function. Pulled it out of the box today to try it out. First, the protective shipping covering on the plate was entirely glued to the iron itself. Had to use warm water and alcohol to get it all off just to plug it in. Filled with water and immediately started leaking out of the bottom...I purchased the extra warranty on this item and hoping it was just a fluke. Very frustrated and disappointed especially considering this was a Prime item.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Howard

customer_reviews.title: A just “ok” iron
customer_reviews.text: This is just an ok iron. A bit disappointing after reading high reviews. It spit water out when using the steam function. It takes wrinkles out with spray starch or a water sprayer; but not with the iron alone. I am UPDATING this review. I used the iron maybe once a week for 4 months and it just died. The customer service number is out of service, non of the customer service emails, phone numbers etc are valid. DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: I never loved it. I was glad when it finally turned ...
customer_reviews.text: We had our old iron for ages. I never loved it. I was glad when it finally turned on the smoke detector of the house, smoked a little, and died. I searched for a few days for its replacement. I wanted something affordable, but not the cheapest iron on the block. I finally went with the Digital Advantage. I love it. I like choosing how hot I want it on the LCD, I like that I can easily steam items as I iron, if needed. I've only had it a month or so, but I can tell you with confidence that this iron is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Way above expections
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this iron for 3 months now am very happy with it. The cord is 8' long, it doesn't drip like my old Rowenta did. The weight of the iron is just perfect, heavy enough not to need extra pressure when ironing and light enough to handle easily. Be sure to read the instructions thoroughly to enjoy all the features. Contrary to some reviews it heats up quickly (1 to 2 minutes at the most). It's a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: V1

customer_reviews.title: has plenty of steam with good weight and size
customer_reviews.text: Heats quickly, has plenty of steam with good weight and size. Only draw back is the dial that controls the steam is easy to inadvertently adjust so you may accidently back down the steam. For some reason I sometimes create wrinkles while ironing creases in my pants while ironing in a leftward motion. The material sort of bunches up as I iron in a rightward motion. Probably just me but never really had that problem in 40 years of ironing.
customer_reviews.author: smoothswede

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a short while and then your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron even after reading some negative reviews, thinking I'd fare better. That was a mistake. It performs well for the first few minutes, but I did have the same issues as many buyers, specifically: the iron will shut off for no particular reason, even after less than 5 minutes of use, and the steam will sometimes stop coming out and then it will start leaking water. And I haven't done any heavy use of it, I'd say I have less than 20 hours of use total. Whenever I replace this iron - and I'm thinking it will not be long - I will definitely buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Herrera B

customer_reviews.title: Like most things in life, good while it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This iron was great for the two months of use I got out of it. However, one weekend morning as I was getting ready to iron clothes for the upcoming work week, this iron had other plans and decided that it just wouldn't work anymore. It's dead after two months of use. My moral compass and aversion to alcohol lasted for a couple of decades, and this iron only lasted TWO MONTHS.
customer_reviews.author: John Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Best iron available despite 3 year lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I'm a seamstress and sew on everything from denim to silk. This iron is superior to any other iron I've used, including Rowentas and Olisos. It has powerful steam capabilities and truly heats up to hot temperatures. It feels great in my hand and I feel I can iron precisely, something I took for granted until I ironed with the Classic Black and Decker iron (which lacks the much needed buttons for shots of steam and mist.) Despite lasting me just under 3 years (it leaked), I'm still giving it 4 stars and I will be purchasing a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I replaced a 20 yr. old Sunbeam with this dream iron.
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a few different irons, none of them would "steam" like this one, or hold alot of "tap" water, or even get hot enough to iron a dress shirt. I had originally wanted an iron with alot of steam holes, but, this one definitely gets the steaming job done. I can use this one as an upright steamer also, I don't usually need that option, but, tried it on a hanging t-shirt and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rudins

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: This product replaced a Rowenta. In fact, I'd had two Rowentas. Their customer service is awful. I iron A LOT and don't mind buying an expensive iron. You don't need to spend a lot on this iron (it was recommended by Consumer Reports). You won't need to deal with customer service. This iron works. It doesn't leak. Save yourself money and frustration and buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 entire months (yes...MONTHS).
customer_reviews.text: This iron worked wonderfully...for 4 months. Then it just died. I was ironing a shirt and 5 minutes into ironing it turned off. I waited 30 minutes...1 hour...4 hours...2 days... trying to turn it on again and it would NOT turn on. I've owned 2 irons before: one lasted about 8 years and the other about 15! What happened here? I asked for an exchange and Amazon kindly issued one. Now let's see if the replacement lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great!
customer_reviews.text: My last basic Black and Decker iron finally conked out... ordered this, shipped super fast and works great. Really easy to set temperature based on fabric. (just push button to choose material type and corresponding number) I didn’t want to have to read the instructions right away, just plug in and use!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannemax

customer_reviews.title: Best iron ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best iron I’ve ever used.... and that’s saying something. I’ve been dissatisfied with so many modern steam irons and was starting to think there were no quality irons. This Black and Decker changed my mind. Easy to pour the water in, heats up quickly and easy to read the iron temperature. Excellent weight, maneuvers great and it just makes my life a little easier....who can ask for more?
customer_reviews.author: LoveTo Read

customer_reviews.title: LIght, precise and irons well
customer_reviews.text: No dripping or spitting. The weight is right for medium duty ironing. I like it far better than some far more expensive irons I've had in the past. It heats up quickly. I dropped a star because it is hard to empty and it seems a little lacking in steaming. The heat setting is discrete instead of continuous so there is less flexibility in temperature. So far, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Fool

customer_reviews.title: The best iron I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: My friend asked for an iron for Christmas. After doing a lot of research, I settled on this one. Since my iron leaked, I decided to buy an iron for me at the same time. I loved it from the second I used it. It doesn't leak, it has a lot of settings, irons smoothly, only uses tap water, and the steam works great. I hate ironing, but when I have to iron this makes it almost pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: I'd caution starch-users that the recommended setting for your fabric is too hot and will ...
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly, I'd caution starch-users that the recommended setting for your fabric is too hot and will burn the starch on the soleplate, which will then come off on your clothing (I iron and starch a lot of cotton dress shirts) The Clean notification is ok, but the "Auto-Clean" is a nuisance and a mess. I find myself going back to the instructions (glad I saved them) every time it comes on and it always takes twice as long to complete as you have available time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schaub

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I wish the cord pulled into the iron for easy put away but it doesn’t so I have to wrap it around the handle. Other than that it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality does what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Several years ago and I figured it’s a good enough time as any to review it. The iron stays very clean even with heavy starch usage. The steam function is pretty sweet and gives a very satisfying cccchhhhchooose sound when you press the steam button. Only downside is when you turn it off it does not hold the last setting. My wife has tested the auto off function throughly and it works as designed if the iron is left unmoved for longer than 10 minutes I think.
customer_reviews.author: Hardcoreairman

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this iron except for one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this iron except for one major flaw. The steam wheel will not stay on high steam. As I am ironing, it goes all the way over to no steam. And then I have to move it back up to full steam again and the cycle starts all over. Black and Decker needs to make it so there are definite stops on each steam level and the wheel can click in place. I bought one, thought it was a dud, and returned it to then find out they are all that way. So this one is going back too. Very frustrating!!!
customer_reviews.author: cinscott

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, poor durability
customer_reviews.text: This Digital Advantage was my second. The first one I had was stellar and worked perfectly but only lasted about 2 years with daily use. The second new one, which is the one I just returned never seemed to heat up properly. It was far inferior to the old identical model. Maybe I was unlucky this time or maybe the quality control has just gone down.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently bought this iron again after having this same model about 6 years. The only thing that went wrong with the old one was that the cord no near the plug didn't make a good connection so I decided to buy a new one of the same model. I use the hold upright steam for getting the wrinkles out of some more delicate cloths which works great. I definitely recommend this iron!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Quick Heating, Burst of Steam and wa la.  Done.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've had this iron over a month and having loved my old iron, I am equally as satisfied with this one. The water reservoir is large and is easy to fill. The steam function works well. Iron heats up quickly. There haven't been any gushes of water from the soleplate.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: long-term
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron 7 years ago. Hopefully they haven't changed anything parts-wise over the years to make it more profitable for B&D. It has been the best and longest lasting iron I have ever owned. It has been with me through it all. It has ironed my clothes 4-5 times a week over that period. No rust, no leaks, great steam. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this iron!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this iron. It was an upgrade from a basic black + decker model I had previously purchased. This one is easy to use and heats up quickly. I do a lot of sewing and really enjoy the fact that it has a timer and auto off function so I don't have to worry about it constantly running.
customer_reviews.author: howard powell

customer_reviews.title: great steam iron, good value
customer_reviews.text: Good controls, good steam, auto off, fast heat up and cool down. If I were to improve it, I would not have the large red light stay lit after it has shut off. The only way to get rid of the light is to unplug the iron. Also, I like cords that store in the bottom of the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Menlo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.  Steam leaks a little bit.
customer_reviews.text: Our old (other brand) iron was leaking lots of water, so I bought this one as a replacement. Great price. It is a very nice iron for what was paid. It is heavy, so it does a great job of pressing. The heat selection is also simple and straight forward; but it does still leak water on occasion. It must be the nature of how the steam system works, it's just a pain when not all of the water gets vaporized before soaking the clothes. That being said though, this one is really not terribly bad like our other one was. It is bigger than I had expected, but that's not a bad thing for us.
customer_reviews.author: James H Hunt III

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Iron!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is fantastic! Easy to use and makes ironing a breeze. I can iron clothes in half the time. Over the years we were using Rowenta irons, but their quality went down and got frustrated with the problems we were having with them. We then decided to choose this Black & Decker iron and have never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The iron stopped working after only using for a few months. Every time I put the iron in the upright position, it shuts off. The iron is under a 2 year warranty so notified Black and Decker about the problem but heard nothing from the company. I will not purchase another product from this company.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Normal Iron
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, But you need to know how to use it, cause for the first days my wife didn't like it, after a while, she discovered how to use it properly and she doesn't have any problem with it. We use this Iron for a 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Tural Mehdiyev

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE: Steam Burst Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'm just unlucky enough to receive a defective product which was probably missed in the quality control process(QC). But apparently, other people have also complained about the same issue... It's brand new with everything working except for the stream burst feature! See this:
customer_reviews.author: azShopper

customer_reviews.title: I love this iron
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. Plentiful steam and ample heat makes it a quilter's best friend. In fact, I far prefer this one to my mom's Rowenta. Update (7/15) - I had to look up which iron I had for someone today and was surprised to see that it had been more than a year since I purchased it. I am every bit as pleased with this iron today as I was when I bought it. I have experienced none of the issues mentioned in the negative reviews. There's still plenty of steam and enough heat to crisply press my seams. I usually miss mine if I have to use someone else's. I still highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: between these days

customer_reviews.title: They don't make irons like they used to
customer_reviews.text: They don't make irons like they used to. However, this iron appears to be legit. It does a great job of providing a good amount of steam, and is heavy enough to actually press my pants the way I like. It's made very well, and gets hot fairly quickly. I've only had it for a couple of weeks, so I'll have to provide a later update on its long-term performance. Overall great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Red River

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Black and Decker Digital Advantage Professional Steam Iron. The first iron last us about 5 years. After it went kaput, we bought another similarly priced iron from Walmart. It is was not nearly as good. So we gave the Walmart iron away and bought another Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Filth and offscouring

customer_reviews.title: Second time is the charm
customer_reviews.text: This is my second D2030. First one lasted for a few years (maybe more) but the digital unit ended up frying. Did some research on a replacement and the D2030 came up as the top pick. The second version is even better than the first. The digital display now shows what setting you've selected (cotton vs. linen) which is a great little help. The steam seems to be even more powerful on this unit than the last. I steam everything instead of ironing and this takes the wrinkles out in only a few presses of the button. I'm thrilled with my new iron (did I just say that about an iron?!).
customer_reviews.author: Denise JL

customer_reviews.title: good iron
customer_reviews.text: Iron surface glides over fabric well, temperature settings easy to manage, water receptacle holds adequate amount. The boot-shaped water cup is really small and requires more than 2 fills to bring the water level up to maximum. The shape of the water cup is fine.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect iron! I had one for 12 years - it broke recently when my son ( who recently started to iron his shirts) dropped it. It has a stainless steel, smooth surface, perfect temperature control and flawless steam and water control. On top of that , the price is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: This thing was expensive and didn't last long. It leaked all the time... the high heat would come and go. Really bad for the money. I was surprised too because I like B&D products.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sottung

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the performance
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a good buy for the price; however, the steam feature never worked properly. I read the manual, followed the directions and poured in the water for steam when ironing. To get steam, I had to manually push the steam button which really wasn't a problem since I could control the amount of steam I wanted. However, the next time I used it instead of a "steam", it spit water every where soaking my ironing board and the fabric I was ironing. This happened several times so I returned the iron for a different brand which has a better rating for quilters.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lisak

customer_reviews.title: Looks like an excellent design
customer_reviews.text: Looks like an excellent design: swivel for cord is great; operation is clear; stainless steel plate is more durable that coated non-stick type; and iron is heavy enough to apply pressure without a lot of muscle strain. I like that it doesn't have a retractable cord: retractables are bulky & never work great. Haven't used the mineral deposit clean-out feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Forburger

customer_reviews.title: Good Iron for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I basically needed an Iron for occasionally iron my dungarees and shirts. Had this Iron for two years now and its still working just fine. My only gripe is that the dial that allows you to select steam is so closely placed under the handle that you end up switching the steam to off. That's the only reason for the 4 stars in stead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: ELLIOTT G.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water!!
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I got was leaking out the box. Leaked on my clothes, not a big deal. I sent it back and ordered a replacement. The replacement's been working fine for about a year or so. Earlier today, we get home and find water everywhere on the kitchen counter. The problem is it made its way into the range and damaged the control board which now thinks the door is open at all times. I cannot be more frustrated with this iron. I should not have given in it a second chance. Also, for what it's worth, I only use distilled water to make sure it doesn't get clogged and cause issues. Didn't seem to matter unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Marwan Dakroub

customer_reviews.title: Worked about 4 times and then it started making a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked about 4 times and then it started making a constant noise and it just no longer worked. Called Black and Decker and they offered... nothing. Nothing - had their product for 2 months and they offer nothing. Buy something else - don't buy Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought cause of reviews, Now it is worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cheap iron because so many had reviewed it and praised it. Two months after the purchase the display blinked out and now I can't set temperature or warm the iron at all. We have a very experienced lady come once a week to iron. So we got eight uses out of this iron before it became nothing more than another appliance littering our landfill. I am once again looking for a quality lasting iron.
customer_reviews.author: JFS789

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for two years, I was never really satisfied but it was working so I thought ok. Yesterday it suddenly sopped working while holding but when I put it back in upright position it started working again. The when I hold it, it turned of itself again. So now it works if I don’t hold it. But I can’t iron without lifting the iron🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Sumeyra Yazici

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Slightly heavy. Big reservoir. Only quibble is that the steam control seems to have a mind of its own. (I reset it often.) But the point is that this is a seriously good iron to use. It works. Lighter irons with small reservoirs simply do not cut it
customer_reviews.author: Geordie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: We thought we would spend a little more for a better iron in hopes that we wouldn't need to replace it anytime soon!! Alas, it lasted less than 4 months before it quit working.... Liked it while it worked!!
customer_reviews.author: S&V Koehn

customer_reviews.title: Great for quilting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for quilting and I love it. It is so much better than my cheap Sunbeam iron from years ago. What a difference in the quality of my blocks! Pros: nice, heavy weight for pressing seams, decent sized water reservoir, digital display tells me when it's ready (no guessing), stainless steel sole plate slides like butter( I will never go back to anything but stainless now). Cons: expensive ( but worth it). I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Summer98

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a pretty decent iron, though it takes longer to heat up than our previous one. Other reviewers have noted the reversed locations of the steam and spray buttons, which definitely takes some getting used to. I also wish it would remember the last heat setting, but always reverts to the lowest heat setting.
customer_reviews.author: John Kutz

customer_reviews.title: It's a good iron, but doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this iron for a little over a year, and it's my second of this model. They both failed due to the wire going bad. Seems to be a consistent problem for this unit. However, I still continue to buy it because it's that good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Romano

customer_reviews.title: Our Iron
customer_reviews.text: Working great, not dripping dirty water and still god as new. Key, we now use bottled water in Iron. We live in an area with horrible water and discovered that it was the cause of the dirt build up in our irons. This one has been great and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water leakage
customer_reviews.text: I only used my iron once per week, only for 3 shirts and 3 pants each time (sometimes i did not use it for 2 weeks). Now it leaks so bad. I refilled water to the hole using the included container. I am going to return it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Digital Advantage Professional Steam Iron, LCD Screen, Gray, D2030
product_meta.description: Style Name:Steam Iron - GrayGet crisp, professional results with any type of fabric. The BLACK+DECKER Digital Advantage Professional Steam Iron features an LCD screen that lets you select and customize the steam level and fabric setting with the touch of a button. This digital electric iron quickly generates dense, powerful steam, and can be used vertically like a steamer with clothes right on the hanger and with drapes and upholstery. The easy-glide, stainless steel soleplate holds up for the long haul, and the 3-way auto shutoff feature gives you peace of mind with each use. Updated features delivering modern convenience is what you’ve come to expect from BLACK+DECKER, the trusted name in clothes irons. Included Components: (1) Digital Iron. Ready Indicator Light - Yes
feature_bullets: Stainless Steel Soleplate - The durable, heavy-duty soleplate glides smoothly over all fabric types to press out wrinkles in no time. Comfort Grip Handle
High Steam Rate - Blast away wrinkles efficiently with customizable digital settings that deliver the perfect amount of steam according to fabric type. Item dimensions is 11 x 5.6 x 4.6 inch

Digital Temperature Control - The clear-view LCD screen makes it easy to customize fabric and steam settings. Plus, the screen will flash “READY” once the iron is preheated to the selected temperature

Variable Temperature and Steam Controls - Independent steam and temperature controls give you the ability to customize each setting separately for the best results across all fabric types. Volts : 120V. Wattage : 1500W
Automatic Shutoff - For added peace of mind, the iron shuts off when left unattended for 30 seconds on its side or soleplate, and after 8 minutes on the heel rest

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars7,380 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
